message: NA

Today I was sworn-in to the U.S. Senate.  It is a tremendous honor and privilege to represent the people of Alabama for another six years.  In this next term, I am committed to continuing my record of service and working to ensure that Alabama’s interests are represented and protected in Washington.   The 115th Congress presents a great opportunity for Alabamians and all Americans under the leadership of President-elect Trump and our Republican majorities in Congress.  From filling the late Justice Antonin Scalia’s seat on the Supreme Court with a conservative voice to rolling back burdensome rules and regulations, I am confident that we will make much-needed progress for our country in the coming weeks, months, and years.
NA

Today I introduced legislation in the Senate proposing a constitutional amendment that would require Congress to have a balanced budget.  The idea behind a balanced budget amendment is simple: the federal government should be required to do what hardworking Americans do every day.  A $19 trillion debt is simply unsustainable and will place a heavy burden on our children and grandchildren if we do not take steps to reverse this irresponsible course.  I’m pleased to once again introduce this common sense policy that would reduce wasteful government spending, restore confidence in our economy, and foster job growth.

Today I was honored to receive the Distinguished Public Service Award from the United States Navy.  This award is the highest recognition that the Secretary may offer a civilian not employed by the Department.  As we begin the 115th Congress, my support for the finest maritime force in the history of the world remains as strong as it has ever been.  I'm proud to reaffirm my commitment to ensuring that the Navy has the capabilities and resources that it requires to be successful.    Read my full statement here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/1/shelby-receives-distinguished-public-service-award-from-the-united-states-navy

Tonight is the College Football National Championship game, and I have placed a friendly wager with South Carolina Senator Tim Scott.  If the Crimson Tide wins, Senator Scott is promising to send Cromer’s Peanuts to my office. If the Tigers win, I will deliver Priester's Pecans to Senator Scott's office.  I have no doubt that Coach Saban will have our team prepared and that he will lead the Tide to another National Championship victory!

Tomorrow morning, I will have the honor of introducing my friend Senator Jeff Sessions at his Senate Judiciary confirmation hearing.  I look forward to discussing his unmatched qualifications to be the next U.S. Attorney General as well as his extraordinary character and integrity.   You can watch the hearing live at 8:30am CT on C-SPAN: https://www.c-span.org/
NA

The Senate Judiciary Committee begins its hearing on the nomination of Senator Jeff Sessions to serve as our next United States Attorney General at 8:30am CT.   Watch me introduce my friend and colleague at this historic hearing:  https://www.c-span.org/video/?420932-1/attorney-general-nominee-jeff-sessions-testifies-confirmation-hearing

It was my distinct pleasure to introduce Jeff Sessions in the Senate Judiciary Committee this morning.  I am confident that the Committee will report favorably and expeditiously his nomination to be the next United States Attorney General.  Read my full remarks here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/1/shelby-introduces-sessions-in-judiciary-committee-ag-confirmation-hearing
In Case You Missed It: I spoke to WSFA-TV today and shared my thoughts on Jeff Sessions' confirmation hearing.
While it was a long day of questioning for Jeff Sessions, he was well-prepared and represented the state of Alabama admirably. #ConfirmSessions
NA

In our first major act in the 115th Congress, Senate Republicans voted last night to pave the way towards repealing and replacing Obamacare with patient-centered health care reforms.  After more than six years since the enactment of the massive government takeover of health care, there is no doubt that Obamacare is broken beyond repair.    Read my full statement here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/1/shelby-senate-lays-groundwork-to-give-americans-relief-from-obamacare

This morning, the Senate Banking Committee will meet on the nomination of Dr. Ben Carson to serve as the next Secretary of the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.    Watch the hearing live online here: http://www.banking.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/hearings?ID=71EDE1AD-9AB5-4BAE-8AF4-C6E26C3DF6A5

The White House has indicated that President Obama plans to release more terrorists from Guantanamo Bay before his final day in office.  The prisoners housed at Guantanamo pose a serious threat to our national security, and I strongly oppose their release or transfer.    It is unfortunate that President Obama has prioritized his legacy over the safety and security of our nation.
It is great news for our state and nation that these two historic sites in Alabama will be honored as national monuments.
NA
Today we pause to reflect on the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. #MLKDay
I enjoyed meeting with students from Baker High School in Mobile and Virgil Grissom High School in Huntsville who are participating in the Close Up - Washington D.C. Educational Programs this week.

I just sat down with Sherri Jackson in my DC office to discuss the upcoming Inauguration, the 115th Congress, President-Elect Trump's nominees, and more.    Tune in to CBS42 tonight to watch the interview: http://wiat.com/.
It was an honor to welcome Alabamians to our nation's capital yesterday.  I hope that they enjoy this historic occasion. #ALinDC

The Inauguration is an extraordinary moment for our nation, and it was my great honor to attend the swearing-in of President Donald J. Trump and Vice President Mike Pence.   Read my full statement here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/1/shelby-statement-on-the-inauguration-of-president-donald-j-trump
NA
NA

As Americans gather for the annual March for Life this Friday, I am proud to support their efforts to protect the unborn.  Today I joined more than 30 of my Senate colleagues in cosponsoring the "No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act." This bill seeks to create a permanent, government-wide prohibition of taxpayer funding for abortion.

This morning in the Senate Banking Committee, I voted for Dr. Ben Carson to become our next Secretary of the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.    It is my hope that the full Senate will swiftly confirm his nomination, and I look forward to working with him.

It is great news that President Trump is already delivering on his promise to get Washington out of the way in order to unleash American job growth and opportunity.    The Obama Administration unnecessarily blocked the Keystone XL Pipeline project for far too long, which delayed the creation of good-paying jobs across the country.

In the 115th Congress, I am honored to be the Chairman of the Senate Rules Committee and to continue to serve on the Banking and Appropriations Committees.  There is much work to be done, and I look forward to hitting the ground running in these committees to deliver results for Alabamians.  Read more about my committee and subcommittee assignments here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/1/shelby-announces-committee-chairmanship-assignments-for-115th-congress

President Trump issued an executive order today regarding sanctuary cities, which are local municipalities that obstruct policies to remove illegal immigrants who have committed crimes.  Sanctuary cities blatantly ignore our nation’s immigration laws, which is why I have long advocated restricting their access to the Department of Justice’s state and local grant funding.    Today's action by President Trump is a step in the right direction, and I look forward to working with his Administration on this important issue.
Today is the annual March for Life event in DC.  I believe that human life is a gift that should be cherished and protected.  #MarchForLife2017

I'm pleased to share that Ryan Williams from Madison, Alabama, recently completed the United States Senate Page Program.  Ryan, a student at Bob Jones High School, is an outstanding young man who represented the state of Alabama extremely well during his time in the program.  The Page Program is a highly rigorous and competitive academic experience that allows students from around the country to play an important role in the day-to-day operations of Congress.  I am grateful for Ryan’s hard work and ambition, and I am confident that he has a bright future ahead.
It was great to see Dr. Billy Hawkins, President of Talladega College, today in my DC office.

Today Aerojet Rocketdyne announced that it is bringing 100 new jobs to Huntsville.  This is excellent news for the area and our entire state.    North Alabama’s world-class workforce and long history of supporting our nation’s space and defense needs makes the area an attractive location for companies looking to grow.

I was proud to support Secretary Elaine Chao today in the Senate.  She will bring great skill and expertise to the Department of Transportation.  I look forward to working with her to modernize and improve our nation’s infrastructure, including many critical priorities in the state of Alabama.

Making good on my promise, I delivered Priester's Pecans to Senator Tim Scott today and congratulated him on Clemson's national championship.  I also reminded him that the 2017 season starts tomorrow with National Signing Day. #RollTide

President Trump has made an outstanding selection in nominating Judge Neil Gorsuch to the Supreme Court.  Justice Antonin Scalia was a conservative lion, and I am confident that Judge Gorsuch will preserve his legacy on the bench for generations to come.   Our next Supreme Court Justice must be a steadfast supporter of the rule of law with an unwavering commitment to the Constitution.  There is no doubt that Judge Gorsuch meets these necessary qualifications.    I look forward to supporting his nomination and urge my Senate colleagues to join me.

Great news: The Senate Judiciary Committee approved the nomination of Senator Jeff Sessions to be our next Attorney General.  I look forward to supporting him when the vote comes before the full Senate.

It is my honor to announce that I have nominated 35 students from across the state of Alabama to attend United States service academies.  Service academies include the U.S. Naval Academy, U.S. Air Force Academy, U.S. Military Academy, and the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy.  These students are among the best and brightest in Alabama as evidenced by their achievements both inside and outside the classroom.  It is my honor to recommend them, and I wish them the very best.   Read more about the students here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?page=1

This morning I had a productive meeting at Mercedes-Benz U.S. International in Vance.  The manufacturing plant has a tremendous impact on our state's economy, and I'm proud to have them in Tuscaloosa County.

I am pleased to share that Elizabeth Lipp, 16, of Mountain Brook and Louise Adair, 13, of Tuscaloosa have been recognized as two of our nation’s top youth volunteers for 2017 by The Prudential Spirit of Community Awards.  I commend these two students for their outstanding dedication to volunteerism.  Read more about Elizabeth, Louise, and other distinguished Alabama finalists here: http://bit.ly/2lhkGXq

Tonight it was my distinct privilege to speak on the Senate floor in support of my friend and our United States Attorney General Jeff Sessions.  Jeff has served the people of Alabama with honor, which is undoubtedly how he will approach the job as our nation’s chief law enforcement officer.         While I will miss partnering with him in the Senate on behalf of our great state, our work together will not come to a close tonight.  I join my fellow Alabamians and Senate colleagues in congratulating Attorney General Sessions, and I look forward to working with him in his new role.  Watch my remarks on the Senate floor below.

I am pleased that Governor Robert Bentley took the appointment of Jeff Sessions' Senate seat very seriously.  While Jeff leaves behind big shoes to fill in the Senate, I have no doubt that Luther Strange will step in to this position seamlessly.   I have always known Luther to have the best interest of the state of Alabama in the forefront of his mind.  I look forward to partnering with him to fight for conservative principles in the Senate.

The Senate confirmed, with my vote, Dr. Tom Price to serve as our next Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services.  I look forward to working with him to replace Obamacare with a health care system that actually works for Alabamians and all Americans.

I'm pleased to announce that I am joining the Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works (EPW).  This is a critical time for our nation’s environment and public works, which is why I am delighted to pick up where Attorney General Sessions left off in the EPW committee.  I look forward to working with my colleagues to protect our nation’s environment while rolling back unnecessary EPA regulations that harm economic growth.  I also stand ready to work with the committee and the Trump Administration to bring infrastructure into the 21st Century both in Alabama and across the country.  Read more here: http://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/2/shelby-joins-environment-and-public-works-committee

Tonight the Senate unanimously confirmed Dr. David Shulkin to serve as our next Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.  I look forward to working with Secretary Shulkin to ensure that our nation's veterans receive the care that they have earned and deserve.
NA

When President Donald Trump nominated Jeff Sessions to serve as our United States Attorney General, there was no doubt in my mind that he was an excellent and wise choice.   Read more in my op-ed in The Daily Caller: http://dailycaller.com/2017/02/16/jeff-sessions-restores-integrity-at-the-doj/

Today I was proud to vote in favor of Scott Pruitt to serve as the Administrator of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.  As a member of the Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works, I look forward to working with Administrator Pruitt in his new role.    Read my full statement below.

Today I met with job creators in Pell City, Warrior, Cullman, Jasper, and Fayette.  I always enjoy the opportunity to talk with my constituents and hear firsthand about the impact of federal policies on Alabama's economy.

I had a great day visiting with constituents in Boligee, Moundville, Linden, Thomasville, and Beatrice today.  Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, and I will continue to fight for them in Washington. cc: Monroe Sausage

I enjoyed spending time with constituents in Robertsdale, Atmore, Castleberry, Opp, and Hartford today.  These small and medium-sized businesses make our state proud and prove that Alabama is open for business. Furniture City
Thanks for having me today, Furniture City!
This morning I enjoyed seeing some of the Lady Knights from Montgomery Catholic Preparatory School before their basketball game in Dothan.

I spent the day traveling around our great state to talk with constituents about the Trump Administration, rolling back burdensome regulations, tax reform, and more.  I enjoyed meeting with Alabamians in Dothan, Headland, Eufaula, Troy, and Midland City.  Todd Farms E&H Steel Corporation Key Hose Lockheed Martin Southern Plastics

I had another great day spending time with Alabamians to discuss the current direction of our nation.  I started the morning at Fort Rucker, Alabama then visited Brantley, Luverne, Greenville, Fort Deposit, and Camden.
Today I enjoyed another day of traveling throughout the state. It was a privilege to spend time with constituents and tour local businesses in Dallas, Perry, Bibb, Chilton, and Autauga counties.

I enjoyed a visit to Gulf States Mobility, Inc. this morning in Wetumpka. They employ 8 Alabamians currently and will soon double the size of the facility, adding 4 more jobs. Out of the 310 certified mobility vendors in the United States, Gulf States Mobility is one of three veteran-owned.

I strongly condemn the recent threats made against the Levite Jewish Community Center in Birmingham.  These threats have no place in our country and should be taken very seriously.  I'm pleased to learn that the FBI is investigating, and I stand with the Jewish community in Birmingham and all across America against these hateful and dangerous actions.
I am deeply saddened by the news coming out of Gulf Shores today. Please join me in praying for all who were injured.
It was great to see former staff member and current Montgomery County Commissioner Ronda McCaul Walker and her husband Jason Walker today in DC.

In tonight’s address to Congress, President Trump laid out his vision for the nation and reiterated his commitment to ensuring that the American people have the opportunity to succeed.  His remarks were a refreshing change from the last eight years, and I look forward to working with him on the many priorities discussed.  In particular, I stand ready to work with the President on overhauling our broken tax code, rolling back burdensome rules and regulations, and getting Washington out of the way so that Americans can get back to work.   It’s time for us to deliver on our promises for the American people.

Today marks the 10th anniversary of the EF4 tornado that devastated Enterprise High School and Coffee County, Alabama. My thoughts and prayers are with my friends in Enterprise as we remember and honor the nine souls lost in this tragic disaster.  http://www.al.com/living/index.ssf/2017/03/march_1st_is_the_10th_annivers.html

It was a privilege to meet this week with Dr. Heather Wilson, President Trump’s nominee for Secretary of the Air Force. As a member of the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on Defense, I look forward to supporting her nomination and urge my Senate colleagues to join me.

This afternoon I watched Attorney General Sessions’ press conference where he thoroughly explained his responses to the Judiciary Committee.  As I have said before, I hold Jeff’s integrity in the highest regard and his action solidifies my respect for his leadership.     I firmly believe that Jeff has committed no wrongdoing and his statement today proves as much.  Attorney General Sessions’ decision to recuse himself was wise, and I fully support him.

The EPA’s rule redefining ‘waters of the United States’ was a prime example of the Obama Administration’s overreach.  The rule placed thousands of streams, creeks, wetlands, ponds, and ditches throughout the country under the control of Washington bureaucrats instead of private property owners.    President Trump’s executive order instructing the EPA and the Army Corps of Engineers to review and reconsider the WOTUS rule is great news for the American people. I look forward to working with the Trump Administration to protect the rights of rural Americans.

I just wrapped up another day of traveling throughout the state to talk with Alabamians about their views on the issues facing our nation.  I enjoyed spending time in Chatom, Silas, Livingston, Aliceville, and Millport.

The safety and security of the American people must be a top priority.  I have always supported a rigorous review of our vetting process for those who cross our nation’s borders, and I am pleased that President Trump has appropriately modified his executive order to achieve this critical goal.    I look forward to working with the Trump Administration and my colleagues in Congress to keep our citizens safe from any individual seeking to enter our nation and do us harm.

I was glad to hear that students from Briarwood Christian School in Birmingham had the opportunity to meet President Trump this morning during their tour of the White House. I welcome these young Alabamians to our nation’s capital and hope that they have a great educational experience.
Did you know that the majority of all the peanuts grown in the United States are grown within a 100-mile radius of Dothan, Alabama?  Dothan Area Chamber of Commerce, City of Dothan Government

It was a pleasure to meet with Emma Turner and Sydney Ross today.  They are in Washington this week representing Alabama in the United States Senate Youth Program.   Emma attends Indian Springs School and Sydney attends Grissom High School.  I am proud to have these bright, young students here in our nation's capital and look forward to seeing their future achievements.
I had a great meeting with Associated Builders & Contractors of Alabama yesterday afternoon. I always enjoy receiving an update on the needs of their industry.

I enjoyed my time today traveling through the great state of Alabama. I appreciate the opportunity I had to speak with business owners and constituents in Florence, Muscle Shoals, Russellville, Haleyville, and Winfield on the current state of our nation.

On March 12, 1946 the War Department renamed the Army Air Forces School ‘Air University.’ To this day, Air University remains the U.S. Air Force’s institution of higher learning and provides education in military subjects to all U.S. military services and air forces of other countries. I am proud that Air University calls Montgomery home.  cc: Maxwell Air Force Base, Alabama

Today’s announcement by NOAA is a critical step towards much-needed reform to the way fish are counted in the Gulf of Mexico. These efforts will help ensure that NOAA counts red snapper where they actually live – on reefs.  I’m pleased that this assessment will provide an independent check on NOAA’s internal counts for red snapper in the Gulf, which is long overdue. My goal has always been, and will continue to be, to get our Gulf fishermen more days out on the water.

Thank you to The American Society of Civil Engineers for the meeting yesterday. I appreciate these Alabamians traveling to our nation's Capitol to update me on several important infrastructure needs in the state.
Great news today from Alabama's Coastal Conservation Association. cc: American Sportsfishing Association; asafishing.org/senator-shelby-leads-way-better-gulf-red-snapper-data/

Today my staff had the privilege of attending the VORTEX-Southeast Media Day in Huntsville, Alabama. I am pleased to see The University of Alabama in Huntsville collaborating with NOAA National Severe Storms Laboratory to promote VORTEX-Southeast’s Tornado Project Field Operations in efforts to study tornadoes in our region.

I am deeply saddened by the tragic news of the passing of Emily Armistead. The state of Alabama and the Republican Party have both suffered a great loss. My thoughts and prayers are with former Chairman Armistead and his family during this difficult time.

I just wrapped up another successful day of traveling through the great state of Alabama. I enjoyed my time meeting with business owners in Dadeville, Lanett, Phenix City, Auburn, Tuskegee, and Union Springs. I appreciate the opportunity to listen to hardworking Alabamians and discuss the current state of our nation.

It was a great privilege to meet World War II Purple Heart recipient John Wesley Garmon and his family. He exemplifies the highest degree of duty and honor. Please join me in thanking Mr. Garmon, along with all of those who are willing to fight for our freedom, for their sacrifices.
I enjoyed meeting with members of the Alabama Cattlemen's Association and hearing about the current issues that impact their industry.

Today's announcement by DRS is great news for Alabama and potential economic growth in the Tuskegee region. I am extremely proud of our state's dynamic workforce and long history of supporting America's men and women in uniform.

I enjoyed my time today traveling through the great state of Alabama. I appreciated the opportunity to meet with business owners and constituents in Huntsville, Decatur, and Moulton and talk with them about the issues facing our nation.

Today I had the honor and privilege of speaking at the Port of Huntsville’s International Intermodal Center’s (IIC) 30th Anniversary celebration. Beginning operations in 1986, the IIC has served as a central hub for receiving, transferring, storing, and distributing goods via air, rail, and highway. I am a proud supporter of the work the IIC does for the great state of Alabama.
Everyone stay safe and please take proper precautions with the impending weather in Alabama today.

While Senate Democrats threaten the first partisan filibuster on a Supreme Court Nominee in American history, I am hopeful that my colleagues will decide to give exceptionally qualified candidate, Judge Gorsuch, the up-or-down vote he deserves.

Judge Gorsuch is one of the most qualified nominees that I have seen while serving in the United States Senate. His background, credentials, and commitment to the Constitution speak for themselves. Unfortunately, Senate Democrats decided to put partisan politics ahead of what is best for our nation.  The American people spoke clearly when they elected President Trump, and their voices deserve to be heard. By filibustering this nomination, the Democrats are disregarding 230 years of precedent and tradition. This is why I fully support changing the Senate rules to confirm Judge Gorsuch to serve on our nation’s highest Court.

President Obama and his administration had a vague and weak Syrian policy that I could not support. However, President Trump’s actions last night in retaliation of Bashar Al-Assad’s use of chemical weapons against innocent civilians were appropriate, targeted, and strategic. I believe that the President must articulate a comprehensive plan to Congress and the American people, one that details how we can best protect our nation’s interests both at home and abroad.

I was proud to support and confirm Judge Neil Gorsuch to serve on the United States Supreme Court. Judge Gorsuch has clearly demonstrated that he consistently applies the law, as it is written, fairly and equally to all.  There is no doubt that Judge Gorsuch will use this position to serve the American people with unwavering commitment to the Constitution, and I am confident that he will preserve the late Justice Antonin Scalia’s legacy on the bench for years to come.

Aerojet Rocketdyne’s announcement today is excellent news for our state. North Alabama remains the nation’s epicenter for aerospace and defense research, development, and production. I am pleased to see Aerojet Rocketdyne investing and growing in Alabama, and I look forward to working with them and other businesses to continue boosting economic development opportunities.

The American people’s trust in their government depends on the integrity and dignity of those in office, and it is clear that Alabamians have lost this in Governor Bentley. As governor, Bentley was elected by the people of Alabama to the highest position of authority and should consequentially treat the office with the utmost respect. I believe he has made the right decision in offering his resignation.   I look forward to working with Lieutenant Governor Kay Ivey in her new capacity as Governor of Alabama.

On Tax Day, the American people are reminded that our nation’s tax code is unnecessarily complex, confusing, and inefficient.  The SMART Act is a straightforward solution that would require taxpayers to only file a simple postcard size return, which would save Americans time and money.  The SMART Act would also allow businesses to redirect resources away from tax compliance and instead focus on expanding their businesses and creating jobs.

I just wrapped up another successful visit to the great state of Alabama. It was a privilege to spend time with constituents and tour local businesses in Fort Payne, Leesburg, Rainbow City, Anniston, Heflin, Roanoke, and Ashland.
‪Enjoyed visiting today with recently-appointed Alabama Attorney General Steven T. Marshall, former Alabama Supreme Court Chief Justice Sue Bell Cobb, and Judge J. Michael Joiner.‬

Agriculture is one of the largest industries in Alabama, and I believe Secretary Perdue will be an excellent proponent of our state’s interests. I offer him my congratulations and look forward to working with him on issues impacting our farmers and rural communities.

Stephen is well-respected across the state of Alabama and is known for his ability to reach across the aisle and get things done. President Trump has made a great pick in nominating someone with Stephen’s level of integrity and character for this esteemed position.

Today I visited with the Alabama Rural Electric Association of Cooperatives about providing secure, reliable energy sources. Grateful for the good work they do in Alabama.  Alabama Rural Electric Association
Enjoyed breakfast this morning with the Huntsville/Madison County Chamber, a good group of hard-working, ambitious people. It’s a great honor to serve as one of their Senators.

I am deeply troubled and disappointed with NOAA’s decision to considerably shorten the federal recreational fishing season for red snapper in the Gulf. NOAA’s announcement today is unacceptable. Over the years, I have consistently authored several provisions to improve the red snapper stock assessments and allowable catch limits. These actions include expanding the state boundary for catching reef fish out to nine miles, which is not subject to the federal season. In fact, the recent FY2017 government funding bill makes this boundary permanent. NOAA’s rule is a significant step backward in our progress to increase limits for private anglers in federal waters. I look forward to working with President Trump and Commerce Secretary Ross to develop a system that actually serves the U.S. recreational fishing community.

This afternoon, I voted to confirm Jay Clayton as the next chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. His background, education, and experience make him particularly well-suited for this respected position. I look forward to working with Mr. Clayton on efforts to promote and sustain our nation’s economic growth.
Today I sat down with Dr. Charles Roberts and Robert Clark from St. Jude Children's Research Hospital to discuss their affiliate clinic in Huntsville and NIH funding. Enjoyed the meeting.
‪Today I celebrated my 83rd birthday with the staff in my Washington office. Thanks for all of the decorations.‬
Today I introduced Jimmy Lyons, Director of the Alabama State Port Authority, during a Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works hearing on water resources.
Visiting with the Tuscaloosa Rotary Honor Flight each year during their time in Washington is a great honor. Yesterday was no exception. We are forever grateful for their service to our country.

Royal Cup Coffee and Tea was founded in 1896 in Birmingham, Alabama. Thank you to Royal Cup and Hatton Smith for making a special Senatorial blend, which I plan to share with all of my Republican Senate colleagues today at lunch.
It was great to have Alabama Football Coach Scott Cochran and his family in Washington today. Roll Tide!

Airport infrastructure directly impacts safety and efficiency, as well as economic competitiveness in communities. Mobile’s airport will see long-term benefits from this grant funding, which will improve aviation services that are important to businesses and residents of South Alabama.

Great news for our country and for Huntsville! Yesterday the U.S. Missile Defense Agency (MDA), based on Huntsville's Redstone Arsenal, successfully intercepted and destroyed an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) target during the first live-fire test of MDA's Ground-Based Midcourse Defense (GMD) system. The GMD is designed to stop missiles – such as North Korean missiles – during the midcourse of their flight through space. This is critical in defending our homeland from U.S. adversaries.
Received The American Conservative Union's Award for Conservative Achievement for my commitment to our nation's foundational principles and the U.S. Constitution. Thank you for the recognition.

Today I questioned Secretary James Mattis & General Joseph Dunford on the Department of Defense Fiscal Year 2018 budget request. General Dunford and I discussed the importance of the Littoral Combat Ship.

Great news for Alabama! This week, President Trump announced his intention to nominate three Alabamians to serve as U.S. Attorneys for the state’s Northern, Middle, and Southern districts.   Jay E. Town, of Huntsville, to be U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Alabama. Since 2005, Jay has been in the Madison County District Attorney's office, where he is a senior prosecutor. He previously served as a judge advocate in the U.S. Marine Corps for 12 years. Jay Town is very qualified and, once confirmed, will be a great fit for the position.   Louis V. Franklin, Sr., of Montgomery, to be U.S. Attorney for the Middle District of Alabama. For close to three decades, Louis has been a federal prosecutor in the Middle District. He was the Assistant U.S. Attorney from 1990 to 1996 and again from 1998 to 2001. Louis Franklin is an honorable pick, and his immense expertise will enable him, once confirmed, to step into this role with ease.  Richard W. Moore, of Mobile, to be U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Alabama. Moore is currently the inspector general for the Tennessee Valley Authority, a position he was nominated to by George W. Bush in 2003. Prior to his time at TVA, he served as an Assistant U.S. Attorney in Alabama’s Southern District from 1985 to 2003. Richard Moore, once confirmed, will serve this post with the utmost integrity.  Congratulations to these three exceptionally qualified nominees. I look forward to working with my colleagues to confirm them in the Senate.

Today I discussed the value of the Port of Mobile with Lieutenant General Todd Semonite, Chief of Engineers and Commanding General of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers.  During today’s Energy and Water Development Appropriations Subcommittee hearing, I highlighted that the Port of Mobile is the nation’s 10th largest seaport and is a major employer in the state. I then went on to question Lt. General Semonite about the Mobile General Reevaluation Report (GRR), which is currently examining the potential deepening and widening of the Port of Mobile. The GRR is expected to be completed in fall of 2019.  Lt. General Semonite spoke to the Port of Mobile’s potential and its ability to continue to put “skin in the game.”  He continued, “These large shippers are going to go where it’s the best business for them … We want to be able to optimize those ports that really have the potential to have national capabilities, and Mobile is certainly one of those.”  Click below to watch the exchange.

Today I had the opportunity to join Alabama State Port Authority Director Jimmy Lyons for a tour of the Port of Mobile, taking a close look at the two new super post-Panamax cranes. Alabama's port grew by 19% in 2016 and was rated the fastest growing port in the nation. Looking forward to its continued growth and impact on our great state.
Today I had a great meeting with Jeff Lynn to discuss the strength of the Alabama Community College System's academic and workforce programs.
On this day 48 years ago, the Eagle landed on the moon for the first time in history following its launch by the Saturn V rocket, made in Alabama at NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center.

During the past twenty years that I have served with Jeff Sessions in the Senate, I have had the opportunity to know him well. He is a man of integrity, loyalty, and extraordinary character. I join the people of Alabama in giving him my deep respect and unwavering support.

As an accomplished environmental engineer from Alabama, Trey Glenn is well-prepared for this new role and challenge as the EPA Region 4 Administrator. Trey has a proven record of leveraging internal and external operations to advance clearly defined goals. Having served as the director of the Alabama Department of Environmental Management, he understands the value and importance of state authority and control. I am confident that Trey will provide respected leadership across the eight state region, while also promoting and protecting a strong and healthy environment.

Today, President Trump nominated four Alabamians to serve as Federal judges in our state.  - Jeff Beaverstock has been nominated to serve as a District Judge on the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Alabama.  - Emily Marks has been nominated to serve as a District Judge on the U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Alabama.    - Terry Moorer has been nominated to serve as a District Judge on the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Alabama.  - Brett Talley has been nominated to serve as a District Judge on the U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Alabama.  This is excellent news from the White House. These four nominees will apply the law in a fair and just manner. I look forward to their confirmation in the Senate.

Today, the Senate confirmed Louis V. Franklin to be U.S. Attorney for Alabama's Middle District and Richard W. Moore to be U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Alabama. Congratulations to these two excellent choices by President Trump. This is great news for our state.
Went LIVE on CNN and Bloomberg today to encourage Alabamians to go to the polls and cast their votes in the United States Senate primary runoff election. Every vote matters.

Last night’s Senate passage of the budget resolution is a critical step toward pro-growth tax reform. Congress now has the opportunity to advance a comprehensive tax overhaul that will shift the nation’s economic landscape and provide relief to middle-class families. Hard-working Alabamians deserve to keep more of their hard-earned money. Passing this budget puts us one step closer to achieving that goal.
Today I had a productive meeting with Mayor Stimpson to discuss important ongoing projects and opportunities for economic growth in Mobile.
I enjoyed spending time with this bright group of students from Muscle Shoals Middle School today during their visit to Washington, DC.
My thoughts and prayers go out to all of those affected by the tragic attack in NYC. We are grateful for the first responders and the law enforcement working to uncover more details.
It was an honor to have had the opportunity to voice my support of Judge Terry Moorer during his confirmation hearing today. Great choice for the state of Alabama.

Today and every day, we remember that freedom comes at a price. We owe a great debt of gratitude to those who have served our country, those who continue to serve, and those that have made the ultimate sacrifice in order to defend our freedoms. Thank you to our veterans. #VeteransDay2017

The Senate today passed legislation to deliver pro-growth tax relief for the American people.  This is a bill that, if signed into law, will positively impact current and future generations by expanding economic opportunities and lowering taxes for the middle-class.  Reducing rates and reforming our tax code will not only put more money in the pockets of hardworking Americans, but it will also allow businesses to create jobs and increase wages.   Tax reform is one of the most important things we can do to help middle-class families.  This is Congress’s opportunity to change Americans’ lives for the better, and I am proud to support these efforts.  https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?ID=0C17F538-0A1B-496C-8C87-70B1F2BC61E0

Voted to approve Jay Powell as chairman of the Federal Reserve during a Senate Banking Committee hearing this morning. Pleased the Committee has overwhelmingly advanced this nomination. I believe Governor Powell is an excellent pick and look forward to his confirmation by the full Senate.

Yesterday we advanced a significant regulatory relief bill out of the Senate Banking Committee with bipartisan support. The legislation works to roll back intrusive regulations on regional and community banks and provides constructive, commonsense reform that would drive economic growth.

OTD: December 14, 1819, #Alabama became the 22nd state admitted to the Union. Happy 198th birthday to my home state, where the first rocket to put humans on the moon was built. I am proud to have the opportunity to serve our state every day and am encouraged by all of the hard-working individuals that make Alabama great. http://cdn.loc.gov/project/lcnet/states/Alabama.html

Early this morning, the Senate passed historic legislation to deliver pro-growth, middle-class tax relief to the American people. This bill not only lowers individual and corporate tax rates, lightening the burden on small businesses, but it works to revitalize our economy – impacting current and future generations to come. Across the nation, this legislation will help create jobs, increase paychecks, and make the tax code simpler and fairer.   I am proud that we are able to work together to fulfill our commitment to deliver real tax reform and put money back in the pockets of the middle-class Americans who have earned it. This is a once-in-a-generation opportunity to change Americans’ lives for the better.

Today's announcement by the Air Force is excellent news for our state and a true testament to Alabama’s work in the defense sector. The strong support of the community, along with the proximity of Dannelly Field to several other major military bases, saving both time and money, led Air Force Secretary Wilson to choose Montgomery for the new F-35A fighter jet program. I am extremely proud of the operational strength of the 187th Fighter Wing, and I look forward to seeing the success of this new undertaking.  https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?ID=681078F4-DDE9-4E8A-8FB1-CC8E99ABC75C
